title: Prudential Financial
subtitle: Internship - Software Engineering
description: Led the development and deployment of API security libraries for enterprise-wide use, utilizing Node.js and React to implement robust OAuth 2.0 workflows. Architected a TypeScript and Node.js library for API role management, now a core component in company-wide templates. Engineered Backend-for-Frontend (BFF) services to optimize data flow between front-end and back-end systems, enhancing performance. Developed a vault secrets management and token verification library for internal authentication, bolstering security.

title: TCNJ
subtitle: Computer Science Peer Mentor
description: Provided mentorship and guidance to computer science students, teaching foundational and complex programming concepts in Java. Promoted best practices in software development and assisted students with lab exercises, fostering a collaborative learning environment.

title: BAE Systems
subtitle: Internship - SWE & Data Analytics
description: Spearheaded the development of a real-time image detection and classification tool using PyTorch, enabling advanced analytics in defense applications. Designed and implemented Java algorithms to convert defense systems into system-based models. Developed and integrated CAMEO plug-ins for internal use, and researched PDF to CSV conversion techniques using deep learning.

title: TCNJ
subtitle: Research - Machine Learning & Computer Vision
description: Conducted research in ASL classification using machine learning and computer vision, implementing deep learning algorithms with PyTorch and Google MediaPipe. Published research findings at ACMâ€™s SIGCSE Technical Symposium and presented them to over 1000 attendees. Currently focused on classifying dynamic ASL signs and collecting large-scale data.

title: The College of New Jersey (TCNJ)
subtitle: B.S. Computer Science - Specialization in Data Science
description: Pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with a specialization in Data Science at TCNJ. Maintaining a GPA of 3.98/4.0, consistently recognized on the Dean's List from 2022 to present.
